Zahra Ahmadipour
Vice President of Iran
Head of Cultural Heritage and Tourism Organization
In office
6 November 2016 – 13 August 2017
President Hassan Rouhani
Preceded by Masoud Soltanifar
Succeeded by Ali Asghar Monesan
Personal details
Born 1960 (age 57–58)
Malayer, Iran
Nationality Iranian
Political party Islamic Association of University Instructors
Alma mater Tarbiat Modares University

Zahra Ahmadipour (Persian: زهرا احمدی‌پور‎, born 1960 in Malayer, Iran) is an Iranian politician and university professor who was the head of Cultural Heritage, Handcrafts and Tourism Organization from 2016 until 2017.[1] She was formerly Director of administrative divisions of the Ministry of Interior for two times, first from 1997 until 2003 and second time in 2016. She was also Vice President of the Physical Education Organization from 2003 until 2005.

References[edit]

  1. ^ زهرا احمدی پور رئیس سازمان گردشگری شد
